summary: This is an email from Nicole Simmons submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for an order authorizing a subpoena pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 17(c)(3) to Judge Nathan. The motion and exhibit are submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Attorney at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who submitted Maxwell's motion to the court via email.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan, the recipient of the email and the motion in the case U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who requested the submission of Maxwell's motion.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. copied on the email.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case U.S. v. Maxwell, for whom the motion for a subpoena is being filed.

persons.name: Feldman
persons.context: Mentioned in the filename of the attached motion, likely a person relevant to the subpoena request.

connections.description: Jeffrey Pagliuca is an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, as evidenced by his request to file a motion on her behalf.
Laura Menninger is an attorney copied on the legal correspondence regarding Maxwell's case.
Both are legal professionals at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., working on Maxwell's defense.
Feldman is likely a person of interest in the subpoena request filed by Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Filing of Motion for Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a motion for an order authorizing a subpoena pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 17(c)(3), likely targeting a person named Feldman.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion for a court order to authorize a subpoena under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 17(c)(3).
The motion and its exhibit were submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose necessary redactions.
The motion appears to be related to an individual named Feldman, as indicated in the attached filename.
The email correspondence shows the defense's legal protocol for submitting sealed motions to the court.
